Title: Product Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

In your role as a Product Analyst (m/f/d), you will work closely with cross-functional Product teams and drive their decision-making and product development with your analytical work.

Job Description


Develop a deep understanding of user behavior in the exciting field of instant grocery delivery and influence our Product roadmap to continually improve our user experience;
Develop and evolve tracking concepts to ensure we collect accurate and reliable data
Build and transform raw event stream data from various sources into our warehouse and therefore enable driving actionable insights & enriching user profiles;
Analyse our conversion funnels in order to understand user behavior and optimize conversion rates;
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests and drive experimentation-led Product development.


Qualifications


Proven experience in an analytical role (e.g. Product Analyst / Data Analyst)
Experience with modern SQL databases (preferably Google BigQuery or Snowflake) or other analytics tooling (for example Python or R);
Experience with analytics engineering (preferably dbt) or willingness to learn
Working knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Enthusiastic about understanding user behaviour and how to build great digital (customer-centric) products;
Very good communication skills in English (spoken & written); German is a plus.


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
PAUL Tech AG is a technology leader in the real estate industry with the mission to make buildings carbon neutral. Our proprietary technology, consisting of IoT-enabled hardware and AI-supported software, permanently optimizes water-bearing systems in buildings. This reduces CO2 emissions and energy costs. Everyone benefits: owners, operators, occupants and the climate. At Paul, we are researchers, developers and practitioners with the common goal of developing intelligent solutions for buildings to combat climate change.

Therefore we are looking for you to drive our scaling as

Data Analyst (m/f/d) in Berlin

Core Responsibilities

Strategic Stakeholder Collaboration


Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs, and objectives



Analytical Problem Framing


Analytical outlook to frame the right questions while diving deep into business domains and processes



Data Integration and Collaboration


Connect data from various sources, collaborating with product managers and engineers to develop comprehensive data solutions



Data Model Development


Develop robust and clean data models, ensuring high-quality data thereby leading high-quality analytics



Insightful Data Communication


Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support product development and decision-making



Data-Driven Decision Support


Support the business decision-making process, by generating analytical solutions by leveraging exploratory data analysis and hypothesis based “proof of concept” framework



The Skillset We Are Looking For


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within a business context
Strong zeal for Data crunching and wrangling
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact



What You Can Expect From Us


A meaningful job that contributes to global CO2 savings
A collegial working atmosphere with short decision paths
A permanent contract with an above-average salary
30 days vacation per calendar year plus 24.12. and 31.12. off
Company private health insurance and supplementary pension
Company fitness subsidy in your region
Regular company events to which you are very welcome
Tram ticket as well as drinks and fruit in our offices



Would you like to become part of us? Then apply here.
Show more

Title: (Junior) Analyst (m/w/d) Data Analytics
Description:
Sie begeistern sich für die Themen Industrie 4.0, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Big Data oder Artificial Intelligence? Sie sind kommunikationsstark und integer? Dann sollten wir uns kennenlernen. Machen Sie mit uns den nächsten Schritt!

Über Syncwork

Die Syncwork AG ist eine inhabergeführte Unternehmensberatung mit Niederlassungen in Berlin, Dresden, Wiesbaden, München, Köln und Zürich. Mit namhaften Kunden aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen wie Life Science, Industrie, Finanzen, Telekommunikation und dem öffentlichen Sektor verbindet uns eine langjährige und vertrauensvolle Kooperation. Wir bieten ein Beratungsportfolio, welches von der Organisations- und Prozessberatung über die Planung und Umsetzung bis zur Realisierung von IT-Lösungen reicht.

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie arbeiten flexibel in interdisziplinären Projektteams aus Kunden- und Syncwork-Mitarbeitenden, direkt bei unseren Kunden vor Ort, von unserem Office bzw. Homeoffice aus.
Sie managen und analysieren große Datenmengen und entwickeln intelligente Algorithmen.
Sie unterstützen bei der Analyse, dem Design und Prototyping sowie bei der Realisierung und dem Rollout innovativer Reporting- und Planungslösungen zur Unternehmenssteuerung mithilfe von Business Intelligence.
Sie konzipieren und realisieren innovative Lösungen im Bereich Industrie 4.0, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Big Data oder Artificial Intelligence.
Sie analysieren Strategien, Organisations- und Kostenstrukturen sowie Prozesse.


Ihr Profil


Sie haben Ihr Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften (BWL, VWL), (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, des (Wirtschafts-)Ingenieurwesens, der Mathematik, ein vergleichbares Studium oder Ihre Ausbildung mit bankfachlichem Hintergrund erfolgreich abgeschlossen.
Sie punkten idealerweise mit praktischen Erfahrungen im Bereich Big Data, Advanced und Data Analytics und haben eine Leidenschaft für neue Technologien und digitale Trends.
Sie besitzen vorteilhafterweise Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen (z. B. R, Python), Datenbanksystemen (z. B. SQL) oder Cloud-Technologien (MS Azure, IBM Bluemix).
Sie denken analytisch und gehen Aufgaben systematisch und strukturiert an.
Sie verfügen über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
Sie wollen durch Ihren Einsatz zum Projekterfolg beitragen und verkörpern unsere durch Teamgeist, Flexibilität und Erfolgswillen geprägte Unternehmenskultur.
Kommunikationsstärke und Eigeninitiative runden Ihr Profil ab.


Unser Angebot


Freuen Sie sich auf eine leistungsorientierte Vergütung, flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, im Homeoffice mit aktuellen Technologien virtuell zusammenzuarbeiten.
Wir wünschen uns, dass Sie mit uns wachsen. Dabei unterstützen und begleiten wir Ihre fachliche und persönliche Entwicklung zielgerichtet und gestalten mit Ihnen zusammen Ihren persönlichen Karriereweg.
Es erwarten Sie ein kollegiales Betriebsklima, zahlreiche Annehmlichkeiten für den beruflichen Alltag sowie verschiedene Rahmenbedingungen, mit denen wir die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf unterstützen.
Show more

Title: Working Student in Data Analysis
Description:
THE ROLE

At Qwist, we recognize the immense value that can be mined from financial data, and that the future of fintech is all about finding innovative ways to use financial data to provide value to customers. In this role, you will be developing and improving Qwist’s Categorisation Engine as well as explore innovative ways to mine value out of transaction data. You will be doing so by using technical data analytics tools and by managing the categorization engine system and its associated knowledge databases.

About The Position

Department: Product

Locations: Berlin, Munich or Hamburg

Number of positions: 1

What Will You Be Doing


Querying and analysing transaction data using Python
Maintaining and improving the performance of the Categorisation Engine’s ML models, including model diagnostics methods such as SHAP values and the use of Python packages CatBoost and scikit-learn
Exploring new technologies and tools that could improve the performance of the engine and mine new value out of transaction data
Exploring and building tools and features that improve the team’s efficiency, e.g. through automation
Review transaction data to find concrete measures to improve the engine’s performance for a variety of use-cases and markets
Contribute to quarterly initiatives for improving the engine’s performance for specific use-cases and markets
Contribute to quarterly initiatives for developing new tools, features and solutions
Support the continuous effort to improve team processes and best practices
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive cross-team initiatives
Collaborate closely with other members of your team to support them on a daily basis
Create clear documentation of your work


What You Bring To The Team


You are a registered student in a University close by one of our offices in Germany (Berlin, Hamburg, or Munich)
You have some experience with Python and are willing to deepen your knowledge on the fly
You have a positive, can-do attitude
You take initiative, are highly self-motivated and enjoy teamwork
You work in a structured and detail-oriented way
You are fluent in business English and have intermediate German knowledge. Advanced knowledge of Spanish, French, Italian or Arabic is a plus
You are tech-savvy and enjoy learning how to use new tools
You are eager to learn and can quickly familiarize yourself with new topics
You like to face new challenges frequently and can quickly adapt to changing conditions


Why Qwist?


Work with a true open banking pioneer and witness the journey/revolution from open banking to open finance and beyond. Work with colleagues with years of experience in the industry and a true passion and vision for the future of open banking.
Healthy work-life balance: Time is precious. Make it count. We enable all our employees to organize their living and working hours flexibly, making it possible to combine personal life with work life!
We are ever-evolving and so are you. We have business goals (OKRs) but also personal development goals. Our formalized bi-annual feedback process, regular Engagement checks and personal development budget are available to make sure that we grow together and find everyone's perfect spot at the table.
You will become part of a cross-functional environment where you will be empowered through ownership and collaboration;
While we offer you the opportunity to work at our Berlin, Hamburg or Munich offices with all its amenities, we have a distributed working style, with semi-regular in-person events and meetings. Productive at home? So are we.


About Us

At Qwist we free Financial Data to improve, ease and enable. We drive real consumer, business and societal change from Open Finance. For over a decade, we’ve powered the largest banks and led the way in the Open Finance ecosystem.

Join our team and be part of empowering everyone to access fair and transparent financial services. Get ready to make a significant impact as we are the leading technology and solution provider for Open Finance.

Qwist is dedicated to accessing, analyzing and harnessing financial data and connecting third-party providers with banks’ account information. We envision ourselves as pioneering the future of Open Finance.

To achieve this goal, we encompass the entire Open Finance ecosystem and offer products for all key users and needs.

Based on our experience – as we power the largest banks for more than a decade – we can connect to 99% of customers bank accounts so, when you need the data on your customer, we will have it. As a regulated financial institution, we are entitled to supply data to your business, even if you don’t have a licence.

Qwist has around 120 employees in 4 countries and serves more than 100 customers in the DACH region as well as in Spain and Portugal, including well-known banks, insurance companies and leading automotive platforms.
Show more
HTML:
THE ROLE

At Qwist, we recognize the immense value that can be mined from financial data, and that the future of fintech is all about finding innovative ways to use financial data to provide value to customers. In this role, you will be developing and improving Qwist’s Categorisation Engine as well as explore innovative ways to mine value out of transaction data. You will be doing so by using technical data analytics tools and by managing the categorization engine system and its associated knowledge databases.

About The Position

Department: Product

Locations: Berlin, Munich or Hamburg

Number of positions: 1

What Will You Be Doing

  • Querying and analysing transaction data using Python
  • Maintaining and improving the performance of the Categorisation Engine’s ML models, including model diagnostics methods such as SHAP values and the use of Python packages CatBoost and scikit-learn
  • Exploring new technologies and tools that could improve the performance of the engine and mine new value out of transaction data
  • Exploring and building tools and features that improve the team’s efficiency, e.g. through automation
  • Review transaction data to find concrete measures to improve the engine’s performance for a variety of use-cases and markets
  • Contribute to quarterly initiatives for improving the engine’s performance for specific use-cases and markets
  • Contribute to quarterly initiatives for developing new tools, features and solutions
  • Support the continuous effort to improve team processes and best practices
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to drive cross-team initiatives
  • Collaborate closely with other members of your team to support them on a daily basis
  • Create clear documentation of your work

What You Bring To The Team

  • You are a registered student in a University close by one of our offices in Germany (Berlin, Hamburg, or Munich)
  • You have some experience with Python and are willing to deepen your knowledge on the fly
  • You have a positive, can-do attitude
  • You take initiative, are highly self-motivated and enjoy teamwork
  • You work in a structured and detail-oriented way
  • You are fluent in business English and have intermediate German knowledge. Advanced knowledge of Spanish, French, Italian or Arabic is a plus
  • You are tech-savvy and enjoy learning how to use new tools
  • You are eager to learn and can quickly familiarize yourself with new topics
  • You like to face new challenges frequently and can quickly adapt to changing conditions

Why Qwist?

  • Work with a true open banking pioneer and witness the journey/revolution from open banking to open finance and beyond. Work with colleagues with years of experience in the industry and a true passion and vision for the future of open banking.
  • Healthy work-life balance: Time is precious. Make it count. We enable all our employees to organize their living and working hours flexibly, making it possible to combine personal life with work life!
  • We are ever-evolving and so are you. We have business goals (OKRs) but also personal development goals. Our formalized bi-annual feedback process, regular Engagement checks and personal development budget are available to make sure that we grow together and find everyone's perfect spot at the table.
  • You will become part of a cross-functional environment where you will be empowered through ownership and collaboration;
  • While we offer you the opportunity to work at our Berlin, Hamburg or Munich offices with all its amenities, we have a distributed working style, with semi-regular in-person events and meetings. Productive at home? So are we.

About Us

At Qwist we free Financial Data to improve, ease and enable. We drive real consumer, business and societal change from Open Finance. For over a decade, we’ve powered the largest banks and led the way in the Open Finance ecosystem.

Join our team and be part of empowering everyone to access fair and transparent financial services. Get ready to make a significant impact as we are the leading technology and solution provider for Open Finance.

Qwist is dedicated to accessing, analyzing and harnessing financial data and connecting third-party providers with banks’ account information. We envision ourselves as pioneering the future of Open Finance.

To achieve this goal, we encompass the entire Open Finance ecosystem and offer products for all key users and needs.

Based on our experience – as we power the largest banks for more than a decade – we can connect to 99% of customers bank accounts so, when you need the data on your customer, we will have it. As a regulated financial institution, we are entitled to supply data to your business, even if you don’t have a licence.

Qwist has around 120 employees in 4 countries and serves more than 100 customers in the DACH region as well as in Spain and Portugal, including well-known banks, insurance companies and leading automotive platforms.

Title: Junior Data & Marketing Analyst
Description:
Almedia is an Ad-Tech company boosting leading brands to engage with broader audiences. Users can enjoy the latest games, apps, and products for rewards.

With our growing community of 35 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing platforms.

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

We are seeking a highly motivated Junior data & Marketing Analyst to join our marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, acquiring, negotiating, maintaining, and optimising relationships with affiliate partners.

What You’ll Do 🎯


Identifying and acquiring new potential partners.
Negotiating deal setups.
Optimizing and making sure campaigns are achieving quality requirements.
Building and maintaining relationships with partners.
Identifying and highlighting industry trends to maximize growth opportunities.
Generating weekly, and monthly reports for internal and external use.
Collaborating with all other departments to build and test both engaging and attractive new propositions for our partners to scale our Partnership.


What You’ll Bring 💡


Strong ability with numbers; studies with engineering, economics, math are a big plus.
Some experience working with performance marketing.
Excellent negotiation, sales skills, and experience with top affiliate networks (Impact, CJ, etc.).
Strategic thinker with strong analytical skills and a results-oriented mindset.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, while being a fast learner and effective collaborator.
Experience in the gaming industry is a plus.


What Makes You a Great Fit 🌟


You're passionate about marketing and making an impact, with a strong desire to grow and take on new challenges.
An independent thinker who thrives with ownership and responsibility, driving results from day one.
A versatile and energetic team player who excels in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? 🚀


Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you’ll have the opportunity to share in Almedia’s success and growth.
Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.


We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth—whether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Über uns - Education Partners

Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners!

Bist du leidenschaftlich daran interessiert, digitale Erlebnisse zu schaffen, die wirklich etwas bewirken?

Wir bei Education Partners sind ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung und gestalten das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.

Deine Aufgaben

Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.


Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.


Dein Profil


Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.


Nice-to-Have:


Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Warum wir?


Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt
Show more

  • Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
  • Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt

Title: Data Analyst m/w/d (Berlin)
Description:
WILLKOMMEN BEI JUNIQE

Wir sind JUNIQE: Seit 2014 bringen wir Design, Kreativität und Inspiration in das Leben unserer Kund:innen. Jetzt haben wir eine neue Mission: Wir wollen der weltweit führende Online-Marktplatz werden, auf dem Creator ihre Designs selbst veröffentlichen und erfolgreich vertreiben können.

Du willst unsere Mission zum weltweit führenden Online-Marktplatz Vollgas vorantreiben?

Daten sind Deine Leidenschaft und Du hast richtig Bock, große Datenmengen in automatisierte Prozesse zu überführen?

Dann bist DU bei uns genau richtig!

Für unser Büro im Herzen Berlins suchen wir DICH als Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Voll- oder Teilzeit.

DEINE CHALLENGE

Als unser:e Data Analyst:in bist Du verantwortlich für die strategische Analyse und Automatisierung von 1st- und 3rd-Party Daten, um nachhaltiges Wachstum zu ermöglichen. Du glaubst an die Anwendung von LLMs, Machine Learning und Automatisierung, um datengetrieben unsere Kernprozesse im Marketing und Sales zu optimieren.

Dein Verantwortungsbereich Umfasst


Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung & Automatisierung: Entwicklung, Steuerung und Skalierung von Kernprozessen durch effiziente Analyse und Automatisierung
Datenintegration & Verknüpfung: Zusammenführung relevanter Datenquellen zur Steigerung der Effizienz
Reporting & Insights: Erstellung von Dashboards und Reports zur datenbasierten Entscheidungsfindung
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit & KI-Innovation: Entwicklung und Implementierung moderner Technologien in enger Abstimmung mit anderen Teams, vor allem Marketing, Produkt und Softwareentwicklung
Technologie- und Trendanalyse: Evaluierung neuer Trends zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung von Datenanalyseprozessen


DEIN PROFIL


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit analytischem Schwerpunkt, Data Science oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Du hast Interesse, unternehmerisch zu arbeiten und Einfluss auf die Business-Performance zu nehmen
Du hast Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit großen Datenmengen und deren Verknüpfung aus verschiedenen Quellen
Du hast verschiedene LLM ausprobiert und Machine Learning operativ eingebunden
Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing mit
Du besitzt grundlegende Python-Kenntnisse zur Automatisierung von Analysen und Datenflüssen
Du denkst analytisch und kannst komplexe Daten in strategische Handlungsempfehlungen übersetzen
Du hast Interesse an neuen Technologien und bist motiviert, Dich stetig weiterzuentwickeln
Du hast idealerweise Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing und SEA, dies ist jedoch nicht zwingend erforderlich
Du bist kommunikationsstark und hast Erfahrung in interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit


ARBEITE MIT JUNIQE

Von Tech-Support bis People-Power: Wir bei JUNIQE glauben, dass Kreativität und Mut der Motor echter Veränderung sind. Bei uns kannst Du Deine eigenen Ideen umsetzen und richtig was bewegen.

Unser mega nettes & internationales Team aus Experten verschiedener Fachbereiche gibt jeden Tag alles, um erstklassige Erlebnisse für unsere Kund:innen und Creator zu erzielen. Bei uns ist Teamwork gefragt: wir inspirieren, unterstützen und fordern uns gegenseitig. Wir bringen Erfahrung mit ein oder probieren auch einfach mal Neues aus - Hauptsache Vollgas und mit viel Herzblut!

Unser lichtdurchflutetes und kreativ gestaltetes Büro bietet viel Platz für eine inspirierende Arbeitsatmosphäre. Ob voller Fokus in einem unserer Meetingräume oder Entspannung bei der Pause in unserer bunten Küche.

WARUM DU MIT UNS ARBEITEN SOLLTEST?


Wir sind ein profitables Familienunternehmen und unabhängig von Investoren
Du bist Teil unseres erstklassigen Marketing-Teams, trägst Verantwortung und hast viel Handlungsspielraum
Unsere flachen Hierarchien ermöglichen es uns, agil zu bleiben und schnelle Entscheidungen zu treffen
Wir lieben es, live & in Farbe im Büro zusammenzuarbeiten und setzen auf ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (mind. 3 Tage Büro) mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, um Dich bei Deinem fachlichen und persönlichen Wachstum zu fördern, einschließlich eines Weiterbildungsbudgets
Tolle Teamevents wie Sommer- oder Halloween-Partys, Get-Togethers im Büro und After-Work-Drinks
Bleibe aktiv: Profitiere vom JobRad und einer vergünstigten EGYM Wellpass Mitgliedschaft
Satte Freibeträge gibt’s auf unsere JUNIQE Produkte und attraktive Angebote bei unseren Partnern
Kaffee, Freigetränke, Snacks und Feierabendbier


Neugierig? Dann raus aus dem 0815 Alltag und werde Teil von JUNIQE!

Über uns

Wir sind JUNIQE. Erfahre mehr unter juniqe.de.
Show more

  • Du bist Teil unseres erstklassigen Marketing-Teams, trägst Verantwortung und hast viel Handlungsspielraum
  • Unsere flachen Hierarchien ermöglichen es uns, agil zu bleiben und schnelle Entscheidungen zu treffen
  • Wir lieben es, live & in Farbe im Büro zusammenzuarbeiten und setzen auf ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (mind. 3 Tage Büro) mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, um Dich bei Deinem fachlichen und persönlichen Wachstum zu fördern, einschließlich eines Weiterbildungsbudgets
  • Tolle Teamevents wie Sommer- oder Halloween-Partys, Get-Togethers im Büro und After-Work-Drinks
  • Bleibe aktiv: Profitiere vom JobRad und einer vergünstigten EGYM Wellpass Mitgliedschaft
  • Satte Freibeträge gibt’s auf unsere JUNIQE Produkte und attraktive Angebote bei unseren Partnern
  • Kaffee, Freigetränke, Snacks und Feierabendbier

Neugierig? Dann raus aus dem 0815 Alltag und werde Teil von JUNIQE!

Über uns

Wir sind JUNIQE. Erfahre mehr unter juniqe.de.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst Student Worker Opportunities
Description:
Start date: July 2025

Duration: 20 hours/week

Type of Employment: Student Worker

Location: Germany, Multiple Locations

Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

As a Marketing Data Analyst Intern you will


support marketing strategy and program development to increase consideration and conversion of Microsoft products and services through partners to contribute to sell-through and meet overall business objectives.
develop data-driven knowledge of partner performance and marketing and leverage partner/consumer centred data to make sound marketing investment and planning decisions.
work with Channel Marketing team to develop analytical capabilities and uncover data-led opportunities to optimize marketing campaign investment and effectiveness.


At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Development and implementation of marketing analytics: Develop and implement integrated marketing analytics aligned with targeted business outcomes for a specific business area. Coordinate with local teams, including Marketing, Sales, Category, Finance, and Business Operations to establish appropriate measures, analyses and insights to support marketing campaigns. Develop actionable performance insights to inform current and future marketing campaigns.

Data Analytics and Reporting: Contribute to the delivery of channel marketing plans by providing detailed reports and analyses of customer & sales metrics. Assist in creating reports and analyses to identify opportunities for improving marketing campaigns. Collaborate with EMEA and WW stakeholders to connect partner insights, marketing investments, and programs.

Performance Analysis: Read and interpret marketing performance and marketing spend reports, using analytical knowledge to extract insights from data. Interpret business implications of results and report findings to stakeholders. Perform and guide analyses to generate insights that address identified business questions.

Data-Driven Insights: Provide data-driven insights to optimize marketing strategy and delivery. Take action based on insights from corporate data, incorporating inclusive marketing and accessibility principles, best practices, and tools in the execution of marketing initiatives.

Stakeholder Coordination: Assist with orchestrating and completing work needed across local stakeholders. Track marketing-related spending against planned estimates and other relevant performance marketing metrics. Ensure event or campaign delivery is consistent with the marketing plan. Review marketing activities.

Marketing Execution: Execute standardized, scalable, compliant, and efficient marketing execution by leveraging global capabilities, engines, and tools in partnership with stakeholders.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, degree in Business, Marketing, Analytics, Communications, Economics, Econometrics, or related field.
Prior experience with data analytics (e.g. Power BI, SQL), data models, performance marketing and marketing mix modelling.
Legally authorized to work in Germany (Legally authorized = Has citizenship or has been granted a valid visa or work permit).
Fluency in English.


Preferred Qualifications


Fluency in German.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528
Show more

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission? Making day-to-day banking easier for SMEs and freelancers thanks to an online business account that's combined with invoicing, bookkeeping and spend management tools. Thanks to its innovative product, highly reactive 24/7 customer support and clear pricing, Qonto has become the leader in its market.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what’s right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

👩‍💻🧑‍💻Your Impact:

Join our team of Marketing data analysts where you'll:


Drive Qonto's acquisition strategy through data-driven insights
Partner with teams across the Growth department, such as Acquisition, Partnership and Sales and help shape the future of our success story .
Be part of a dynamic Business Analytics organization that's central to Qonto's strategic decisions


🎯 Your Key Missions:


Acquisition Monitoring and optimisation: Setup dashboards and analysis that enable to improve the performance of our acquisition throughout the funnel and through our multi channel touch points.
Marketing Campaign measurement and testing: Design success metric and a measurement protocols to measure incremental impact of Acquisition Channel key initiatives and campaigns.
Growth deep dives: Lead investigations into performance patterns, transforming data anomalies into actionable acquisition strategies
Analytics Democratization: Create intuitive self-service analytics tools that empower our Growth team to make data-driven decisions
Strategic Partnership: Be the trusted data advisor to our Growth department, challenging assumptions and driving data-informed strategies
Quality Champion: Help set new standards for analytics excellence, ensuring our insights are both powerful and reliable


👥 The Team Experience:


Work alongside a diverse, international team of five growth experts spread across Europe
Learn from various experience levels, including staff members and senior analysts
Enjoy a culture that values autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationships
Tackle exciting challenges that require creative problem-solving and innovative thinking


🤝 Your Future Manager: Omar

Meet Omar, our Lead Data Analyst who:


Built Qonto's analytics team and scaled it from 4 to 25 talented individuals in 4 years
Has deep understanding of our Product & Growth Strategies
Is passionate about mentoring and developing data talent
Will help you grow both technically and strategically in your role
Brings rich experience from airline revenue management and ad tech industries


🏅 What Makes You Stand Out:


Analytical Prowess: You have a proven track record in growth analytics, particularly in areas of Customer Acquisition & Multi-channel attribution
Business Acumen: You don't just crunch numbers - you understand the business implications behind them
Technical Excellence: You're proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau, with an eagerness to expand your technical toolkit
Communication: You can translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations
Innovation Mindset: You're excited about finding creative solutions to complex data challenges
Statistical Thinking: You can distinguish meaningful patterns from statistical noise


♟️ Why This Role Matters:


Direct impact on Qonto's European acquisition strategy
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge analytics tools and methodologies
Chance to shape the future of business banking
Work in a fast-growing scale-up that values data-driven decision-making


Diversity & Inclusion:

At Qonto, diversity isn't a checkbox - it's our strength. We believe the best teams are built on different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. We encourage applications from everyone who feels they can contribute to our mission, regardless of traditional qualifications.

🏆 What We Offer:


Work with a purpose: Help transform business banking across Europe
Growth opportunities: Learn from experienced data leaders and tackle complex challenges
International exposure: Collaborate with teams across multiple European markets
Innovation culture: Be part of a team that's pushing the boundaries of fintech


At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

🎁 Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.


Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
Competitive salary package;
A meal voucher;
Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
A great health insurance (depending on the country);
Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
Monthly team events.


💬 Our hiring process:


Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Les Échos I L'Usine Digitale | Courrier Cadres

To know how your personal data will be processed during your application process or to request its deletion, please click here .

Title: AI Data Analyst (m/w/d) – Daten, Automatisierung & KI-Innovation
Description:
Das Unternehmen




Unser Kunde, ein dynamisches, profitables Unternehmen im E-Commerce sucht aktuell einen AI Analyst (m/w/d), der datengetriebene Prozesse optimiert und Automatisierungslösungen entwickelt.

Das Unternehmen hat sich als führende Plattform in seiner Nische etabliert und verbindet Technologie mit kreativen Produkten. Mit einem starken digitalen Fokus setzt es auf innovative Datenstrategien, um personalisierte Erlebnisse für seine Kunden zu schaffen. Hier bekommst du die Möglichkeit, modernste KI-Technologien in einem datengetriebenen Umfeld einzusetzen und direkt Einfluss auf das Wachstum des Unternehmens zu nehmen.




Deine Rolle

Du bist ein analytischer Kopf mit einem Gespür für datenbasierte Optimierung? In dieser Position übernimmst du die Verantwortung für die Analyse, Integration und Automatisierung von Datenprozessen, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen und operative Abläufe effizienter zu gestalten.

Deine Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

Effiziente Datenverarbeitung & Automatisierung – Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Workflows zur Optimierung unternehmensweiter Prozesse
KI-gestützte Optimierung: Einsatz moderner Technologien wie Machine Learning zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen
Analyse & Reporting – Erstellung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Trends und Geschäftskennzahlen
Datenverknüpfung & -modellierung – Strukturierung und Integration heterogener Datenquellen für eine konsistente und belastbare Datenbasis
Technologieeinsatz & Innovation – Identifikation neuer Tools und Methoden zur Automatisierung von Analyse- und Reportingprozessen
Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams – Unterstützung von Fachbereichen wie Marketing, Produktentwicklung und IT durch datenbasierte Erkenntnisse




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem oder technischem Schwerpunkt (z. B. Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit Fokus auf Analytics)
Mind. 1 Jahr berufliche Erfahrung im eCommerce
Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Quellen
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie praktische Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing
Grundlegende Programmierkenntnisse (z. B. Python) zur Automatisierung von Abläufen von Vorteil
Strukturierte, analytische Denkweise mit der Fähigkeit, Daten in umsetzbare Maßnahmen zu übersetzen
Interesse an datengetriebenen Geschäftsmodellen und digitalen Märkten
Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing, Web-Analytics ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss




Was dich erwartet

Verantwortung & Gestaltungsspielraum – Du hast direkten Einfluss auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen und kannst eigene Ideen einbringen
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell – Flexibilität zwischen Homeoffice und Büro, angepasst an deine Bedürfnisse
Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten – Individuelle Entwicklung durch Schulungen, Workshops und regelmäßiges Feedback
Attraktive Zusatzleistungen – Vergünstigungen für Sportangebote, Mobilitätslösungen und exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Dynamische Unternehmenskultur – Ein motiviertes Team, das sich gegenseitig inspiriert und gemeinsam Erfolge feiert




Bereit, Daten in wertvolle Insights zu verwandeln? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more

Das Unternehmen


Unser Kunde, ein dynamisches, profitables Unternehmen im E-Commerce sucht aktuell einen AI Analyst (m/w/d), der datengetriebene Prozesse optimiert und Automatisierungslösungen entwickelt.

Das Unternehmen hat sich als führende Plattform in seiner Nische etabliert und verbindet Technologie mit kreativen Produkten. Mit einem starken digitalen Fokus setzt es auf innovative Datenstrategien, um personalisierte Erlebnisse für seine Kunden zu schaffen. Hier bekommst du die Möglichkeit, modernste KI-Technologien in einem datengetriebenen Umfeld einzusetzen und direkt Einfluss auf das Wachstum des Unternehmens zu nehmen.


Deine Rolle

Du bist ein analytischer Kopf mit einem Gespür für datenbasierte Optimierung? In dieser Position übernimmst du die Verantwortung für die Analyse, Integration und Automatisierung von Datenprozessen, um strategische Entscheidungen zu unterstützen und operative Abläufe effizienter zu gestalten.

Deine Hauptaufgaben umfassen:

  • Effiziente Datenverarbeitung & Automatisierung – Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Workflows zur Optimierung unternehmensweiter Prozesse
  • KI-gestützte Optimierung: Einsatz moderner Technologien wie Machine Learning zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen
  • Analyse & Reporting – Erstellung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Trends und Geschäftskennzahlen
  • Datenverknüpfung & -modellierung – Strukturierung und Integration heterogener Datenquellen für eine konsistente und belastbare Datenbasis
  • Technologieeinsatz & Innovation – Identifikation neuer Tools und Methoden zur Automatisierung von Analyse- und Reportingprozessen
  • Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams – Unterstützung von Fachbereichen wie Marketing, Produktentwicklung und IT durch datenbasierte Erkenntnisse


Dein Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem oder technischem Schwerpunkt (z. B. Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit Fokus auf Analytics)
  • Mind. 1 Jahr berufliche Erfahrung im eCommerce
  • Erfahrung in der Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Quellen
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie praktische Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing
  • Grundlegende Programmierkenntnisse (z. B. Python) zur Automatisierung von Abläufen von Vorteil
  • Strukturierte, analytische Denkweise mit der Fähigkeit, Daten in umsetzbare Maßnahmen zu übersetzen
  • Interesse an datengetriebenen Geschäftsmodellen und digitalen Märkten
  • Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing, Web-Analytics ist ein Plus, aber kein Muss


Was dich erwartet

  • Verantwortung & Gestaltungsspielraum – Du hast direkten Einfluss auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen und kannst eigene Ideen einbringen
  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell – Flexibilität zwischen Homeoffice und Büro, angepasst an deine Bedürfnisse
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten – Individuelle Entwicklung durch Schulungen, Workshops und regelmäßiges Feedback
  • Attraktive Zusatzleistungen – Vergünstigungen für Sportangebote, Mobilitätslösungen und exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte
  • Dynamische Unternehmenskultur – Ein motiviertes Team, das sich gegenseitig inspiriert und gemeinsam Erfolge feiert


Bereit, Daten in wertvolle Insights zu verwandeln? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Show more

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Entyre, our mission is to reduce both under and over-provision of healthcare through the intelligent combination of human expertise and technology. Our dedicated care consultants work tirelessly on an international level, supported by our proprietary software solutions.

We believe that individuals in need of care, who are looked after by their relatives at home, have the right to live a self-determined and dignified life in their own homes. With our brands Pflegewegweiser and Entyre Care, we are committed to achieving this goal by focusing on two central pillars: providing professional support to caregiving relatives in all areas of home care with our extensive expertise and ensuring fair monetary compensation for their efforts. We are also driving the development of innovative solutions in collaboration with scientific partners.

In this vital, dynamic, and international environment, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.







Key Responsibilities

Develop data models with DBT on DataBricks for marketing, sales and operations
Develop optimized SQL queries to aggregate and explore data from multiple datasets, identify opportunities and limitations within our data sets and deliver reliable and high quality analysis to drive strategic insights.
Translate complex data insights into compelling narratives that drive action across marketing and leadership teams.
Enable teams with self-service analytics by maintaining curated data sources and developing automated, scalable dashboards by applying intuitive data visualization and dashboard design best practices.
Own key projects and respond to ad-hoc data requests from internal and external stakeholders. Define, calculate, and validate key performance metrics (KPIs), identifying automation opportunities and developing self-service analytics solutions.
Communicate with stakeholders on various projects to gather requirements, collect feedback and present deliverables to achieve expected outcomes.
Brainstorm creative solutions to exploratory projects built around ambiguity, including running analysis to identify problems, understand root cause of trends, provide actionable insights and recommend solutions.
Work collaboratively and cross functionally with other members of the data team to support testing/experimentation, data modeling, data visualization & data science.
Collaborate with data scientists to leverage A/B testing and incrementality analysis to measure marketing effectiveness and optimize campaign performance.




Value Proposition

Make a Life-Changing Impact: Your analyses will directly contribute to improving the lives of millions. You will play a crucial role in helping low-income families access quality homecare.
Personal Growth and Learning Opportunities: Join a vibrant, dedicated team and contribute to building the next industry-defining company. You’ll gain exposure to various aspects of the business while expanding your skills.
Energizing & Flat Hierarchy Team Culture: We care deeply about one another and are committed to collaboration and teamwork. You’ll have the autonomy to drive your initiatives and make a meaningful impact.




Hard Requirements

Minimum of 4 years of experience in growth marketing analytics, data science, preferably in direct-to-consumer and e-commerce companies.
Experience with marketing analytics, attribution modelling, customer segmentation, and predictive modelling for growth and retention.
Expertise in SQL and proficiency in either Python (or R) for advanced data analysis and automation. Experience with dbt, Looker, or other modern analytics tools is a plus.
Familiarity with B2C acquisition and subscription marketing concepts and metrics, including customer journeys, conversion funnels and critical reporting (CAC, payback, retention rate, etc.).
Hands-on experience working with structured and unstructured data in cloud-based environments, like Databricks, BigQuery etc.
Comfortable navigating large datasets, acquiring and cleansing data from multiple sources.
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity, a self-motivated approach to problem-solving, and a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to be a self starter and work independently.
Advanced data visualization skills
Familiarity with marketing, CRM, social and ad platforms, such as HubSpot, Google Ads, Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok and others. Experience with partnership and affiliate marketing is a plus.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into business-friendly insights.
Ability to collaborate with partners to document key business needs into a clearly defined requirements document and project plan.
Proven skills in distilling complex topics into easy to understand data visualizations. Advanced Tableau data visualization skills preferred.







Soft Requirements

Passionate and Impact-Driven: You thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to contribute to transformational change in the healthcare industry.
Strategic Thinker: You have strong strategic thinking abilities combined with a hands-on execution mindset. You understand the importance of data in driving marketing initiatives.
Detail-Oriented: Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in data analysis and reporting.
Open-Minded and Team Player: You enjoy collaborating with others and have a willingness to learn and adapt. You view challenges as opportunities for growth and innovation.




Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in redefining homecare!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
We at Friendsurance

We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities


Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.


How You Will Contribute


Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value


By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!

Your profile


5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.


We as a Team

We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.

At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.

Our offer


100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!


Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application <3

About Us

Friendsurance is a Berlin-based Insurtech company, providing easy-to-use innovative insurance solutions for B2C clients and B2B partners.

With partners like Deutsche Bank and Allianz, Friendsurance ist the N°1 bancassurance platform provider in Europe. We work with 7 bancassurance partners, connecting 175 insurers and 50 million addressable users.

Ready to join us?

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.


Show more
HTML:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will

  • Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
  • Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
  • Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
  • Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.

Who You Are

  • 8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
  • Strong project management skills
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
  • Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice To Have

  • Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
  • Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
  • Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
  • GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
  • Relocation assistance if needed

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.
