Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world’s most admired and respected institutional investors. With more than $600 billion in assets under management, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure it is financially sustainable for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

Job Summary

As a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence, you will assist in gathering, managing, analyzing, and reporting of financial data to enable actionable insights and recommendations that support strategic decision-making processes. You will also be responsible for designing new dashboards to measure, analyze, and explain key aspects of the Fund’s activities.

Team Description

The Business Intelligence team works together with the other teams within the Management Analytics group to provide financial information and insights on performance, cost and exposure. The group’s on-going efforts enhance management decision-making capabilities at both the department and total Fund levels.

Accountabilities


Support in the development of compelling materials to facilitate discussions and drive data-centric decision-making, including creatively conveying data and analysis with charts, tables and other visuals in pre-read and presentation materials using various visualization tools e.g. QuickSight and/or Tableau.
Support Product Owners with analysis, prioritization, planning and delivery of new features and capabilities based on user needs.
Partner effectively with multiple stakeholders to deliver effective presentations and create visual displays of quantitative information.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build, and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
Leverage analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills to work with data providers and end users in assessing, transforming, and storing data for analytical and reporting requirements.
Manage your own workload to perform time-sensitive requests accurately and on time, while building effective working relationships within your team and across various groups at CPP Investments.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics and reporting to enhance skills and capabilities.
Assist in developing tests and automating control checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used.
Contribute to cross functional projects and initiatives by identifying issues, assessing implications, recommending solutions, and proactively managing tasks and timelines.


Qualifications


Undergraduate degree or college diploma in related field.
3+ year of relevant experience.
Relevant professional designation (MBA, CPA or CFA) or progression toward one considered an asset.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience in other relevant applications (e.g. QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to produce insightful analysis of business issues and suggest potential solutions
Experience with SQL and Python are assets.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with a client-centric mindset
Team player, eager to learn, adaptable and calm under pressure.
Proven ability to work independently as well as to perform effectively in a team-oriented and open-concept environment.


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Analytics and Insight Professional, Amazon Advertising
Description:
Description

Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of e-commerce and advertising, offering a rich array of advertising solutions. We partner with advertisers to reach Amazon customers on Amazon.ca, across our other owned and operated sites like Prime Video and IMDb, on other high-quality sites across the web, and on devices. The Analytics & Insights (A&I) organization develops actionable insights using Amazon's unique data to influence how advertisers promote their businesses. Our insights and measurement solutions enhance their marketing decision-making, leading to them being measurably more successful with Amazon. The A&I organization consists of a variety of different practices, which are groups that focus on different approaches to create these insights.

We are currently looking for a highly skilled and motivated Analytics and Insight Professional (AIP) to help scale our growing advertising business. The AIP is a key member of the Customer Success Team at Amazon Advertising, taking a consultative approach, building deep relationships with advertisers, sales, account management, retail, and other Amazon business partners to analyze and measure the success of advertisers' performance on Amazon. On a daily basis, AIP activities include analyzing metrics of success for a business or category, developing data-driven insights and recommendations for executive client leadership, and communicating recommendations in a clear and compelling fashion. The strategic and consultative digital expertise of an AIP is critical to delivering the best return on investment for our customers.

Key job responsibilities


Leverage Amazon's proprietary data and tools, as well as third-party research solutions, to generate insights.
Utilize your advertising industry expertise and understanding of our customers’ business to provide guidance to C-suite marketing leaders, via compelling narratives and frequent in-person client presentations to iterate on and articulate a brand’s strategy
Present findings and insights in a consultative approach to the client and collaborate with the relevant internal teams in order to provide a complete solution
Deal with ambiguity to decipher complex problems, select ideal solutions from a wide array of analytical techniques and concepts, and translate these into actionable recommendations.
Collaborate cross-functionally, communicate effectively across multiple business functions and geographies, and influence marketing initiatives.
Own account-level data and/or analytics-related strategic conversations internally and externally.
Demonstrate deep analytical ability and develop expertise in Amazon's proprietary metrics, constantly evolving how we analyze and communicate data-driven insights to our advertisers.
Educate your internal and external stakeholders on Amazon insights and measurement offerings by delivering learning sessions, writing training documentation, and producing whitepapers.
Advocate for data-driven decision making and encourage clients to act on recommendations, and drive thought leadership.
Demonstrate a passion for learning new skills and adopting new methodologies and tools.


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree plus 10+ years of experience in client-facing data analysis roles.
5+ years of experience in a consulting role in the digital media/AdTech space, or 5+ years of advertising experience with a top advertiser (agency or client-side).
Ability to translate technical aspects of analysis and metrics into actionable insights for advertisers and both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent data-driven storytelling skills - you can create and deliver compelling, complex analyses in a simple way with outstanding visuals.
Demonstrated expertise in advertising measurement methodologies, experimentation, marketing mix modeling, and consumer insights research.
In-depth understanding of advanced statistical techniques and methodologies, as well as simple linear regression analysis, multivariate regression analysis, and model building.
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write queries from scratch, create appropriate joins, extract and manipulate data, format fields, and create new measures and metrics.
Fluency with analytical tools (Python, R, SAS, etc.).
Complete understanding of the end-to-end process of marketing campaigns.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with advertising publishers and marketing/creative agencies.
MBA, Master's degree in Economics, Marketing, Statistics, Advertising, or Business/Digital media planning experience.
Experience in performance advertising in a role where you managed significant complexity and scaling challenges.
Experience and familiarity with the AWS stack.
Experience in campaign management and set up.


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Company - Amazon Advertising Canada Inc. - D49

Job ID: A2921799

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

We are Dentsu. We innovate in the way brands are built. That means we do things differently to make them better than they were before. In this way, we ensure that our clients' most important marketing assets - their brands - win in a changing world. Dentsu innovates the way brands are built for its clients through its world-class expertise and capabilities in media, customer relationship management and creative communications services. Headquartered in London, Dentsu operates in 145 countries around the world with more than 50,000 dedicated specialists.

The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for managing client relationships while delivering comprehensive data analysis, reporting solutions, and actionable insights across various paid media and advertising platforms. This role combines technical expertise with strong client-facing abilities, requiring someone who can independently handle both the technical implementation and strategic communication aspects of the position.

Responsibilities:


Client Relationship Management
Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients, building strong relationships and understanding their business objectives
Lead client meetings and presentations, clearly communicating complex data insights in accessible terms
Proactively identify opportunities to improve client performance and satisfaction
Paid Media Analysis & Reporting
Develop and maintain automated reporting solutions across multiple paid media platforms
Extract, transform, and analyze campaign performance data to drive optimization recommendations
Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards that effectively communicate media performance metrics
Connect paid media performance to on-site behaviors and conversion activities
Platform Expertise
Maintain deep knowledge of major paid media platforms, their data structures, and reporting capabilities
Proficient with Adobe Experience Platform and Adobe Analytics for integrated customer journey analysis
Ability to connect paid media data with web analytics data to provide holistic performance insights
Stay current with platform updates, new features, and best practices
Technical Implementation
Build and maintain data pipelines for efficient processing of advertising data
Implement tracking solutions and ensure proper data collection across paid media and web touchpoints
Develop custom scripts and tools to automate routine tasks and enhance reporting capabilities
Configure platform integrations to create unified reporting views across the customer journey


Qualifications:


Proficient in SQL, Python, and/or R for data manipulation and analysis
Strong experience with Adobe Experience Platform and Adobe Analytics
Hands-on experience with major paid media platforms and their APIs (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries
Experience with ETL processes and data pipeline development
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines
Proven ability to work independently while managing multiple client relationships
Problem-solving mindset with attention to detail and data accuracy
3+ years of experience in digital analytics, preferably in an agency environment with a focus on paid media



Nice-to-Have Skills:


Experience working with financial institutions and understanding their unique regulatory and compliance requirements
Knowledge of financial services marketing regulations and privacy considerations
Experience with data cleanroom environments (Amazon Marketing Cloud, Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp)
Knowledge of tag management systems (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch)
Familiarity with cross-channel attribution models and multi-touch conversion analysis
Experience with identity resolution and audience management platforms
Experience with A/B testing and experiment design for paid media
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) for data processing
Experience with privacy-compliant data collection practices in a cookieless environment



The salary range for this position is $65k-$75k. Actual salary within the salary range will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, and skills. A range of medical, dental, RRSP, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available to all permanent employees.

We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Canada.Recruitment@dentsu.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

Title: ICQA Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Brampton, Ontario

Job Description

Job Description


The Data Analyst position assigned to the Inventory Control/Quality Assurance is responsible for creating performance metrics, collecting performance data, and applying appropriate analytical methodologies and visualization techniques to demonstrate significant trends and patterns by monitoring all inventory control indicators, transactions, and quality control metrics for the Supply Chain network.
This position will be required to interface with the Executive team, DC Leadership team, Inventory Control/Quality Assurance (ICQA) team, and all other business Partners to address Data Analysis and Report trackers required to support the business.
Designing, developing and implementing data collection and analysis processes and data management systems.
Use Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) tools and process to collect, connect and validate data from a variety of sources for analysis.
Identifying, gathering, analyzing data and presenting analytical findings to answer business questions, inform business decisions, provide guidance or recommendations for action to the Leadership and drive business growth.
Designing and building queries, compiling data, and generating Reports, Dashboards and/or Dossiers including visuals to communicate findings to stakeholders by presenting data in charts, graphs, and tables to show trends visually.
Monitoring critical KPIs by developing advanced automated reporting based on data from multiple data sources: EDI, Tableau, OMS, Traverse, 3PL Management, TMS, MAWM Data, MS Access, MS Table, Excel.
Ensuring that all ICQA Network Reports/KPI are properly formatted and regularly distributed to the management team assist in prompt resolution of all ICQA issues or concerns.
Utilizing mathematical, statistical, and graphing tools to analyze data.
Ensuring that all data requests from the business needs are properly executed.
Creating and maintaining documentation and ensure proper usage of these custom solutions, including reports, dashboard, macros, etc.
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Works with the end users to create functional requirements & technical documents.
Work with project managers to help meet the project milestones for data/reporting efforts.
Assisting to solve Supply Chain challenges through data analysis, root-cause analysis, measure performance metrics, and provide overall insights and analysis support.
The role will be hands-on and understand data from a business operations and day to day reporting/business intelligence perspective, including supporting quick insights discovery and experiments. Performing research, applying appropriate analytical methodologies, and summarize findings for complex problems.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.
Additional responsibilities as required.


Required Qualifications


3+ years of experience as a data analyst within a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical skills and experience using data query systems, such as SQL, or No-SQL to extract, manipulate, and analyze data.
Have knowledge of data processing, data exploration, and making strategic and effective recommendations
Proficiency with data manipulation tools including Excel, Python, etc.
Experience with data visualization best practices and tools such as Tableau, Power BI
Understanding requirements from business partners and delivering data sets or analysis on time
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to construct analytic solutions to business problems.
Proven ability to demonstrate a high level of independent judgment and initiative.
Proven ability to communicate effectively in a manner that is clear, logical, and concise.
Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact and influence peers and business partners.
Strong development, motivational, and negotiating skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, ability to interact with and influence decision-making by non-analytical business audiences.
Excellent attention to detail and work with the highest level of accuracy

Title: Intern - Data and Analytics
Description:
(Toronto, ON)

Summer 2025 Internship

On-Site: 5 days/week

Full-time. Paid Internship

Duration: June - August 2025

About Tilray Brands, Inc.

Tilray Brands, Inc. (“Tilray”) (Nasdaq: TLRY; TSX: TLRY), is a leading global lifestyle and consumer packaged goods company with operations in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia, and Latin America that is leading as a transformative force at the nexus of cannabis, beverage, wellness, and entertainment, elevating lives through moments of connection. Tilray’s mission is to be a leading premium lifestyle company with a house of brands and innovative products that inspire joy, wellness and create memorable experiences. Tilray’s unprecedented platform supports over 40 brands in over 20 countries, including comprehensive cannabis offerings, hemp-based foods, and craft beverages.

Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry?

JOB SUMMARY:

As the Data & Analytics Intern, you will have the opportunity to apply your knowledge on a real-world project relating to data structuring, cleaning, transforming, loading, storing, consolidating, and visualizing.

Reporting to the Director, Data and Analytics the Data and Analytics, intern would work on a project requiring stakeholder input from cross-functional teams.

This is a great 3-month paid internship opportunity for third or fourth-year students, as well as new graduates looking for real-world experience. The project will encompass data consolidation, with implementation of ETL, data modelling, data setup, data mapping, data warehousing in preparation of utilizing AI and ML models.

REQUIREMENTS:


ERP Systems Management: Ensure efficient operation and integration of ERP systems.
Master Data Structures: Manage and maintain master data structures, including Bills of Materials and reporting attributes/dimensions.
Microsoft Azure Cloud Platform: Utilize Microsoft Azure Cloud Platform offerings to support business operations.
Business Central: Implement and manage Business Central solutions.
Power Platform: Develop and maintain applications using the Power Platform.
Microsoft Co-Pilot: Leverage Microsoft Co-Pilot for enhanced productivity and collaboration.
Fabric: Work with Fabric to support data integration and management.
Data Lakes: Manage and utilize data lakes for storage and analysis.
Data Warehousing (SQL): Design, implement, and maintain data warehousing solutions using SQL.
Python Programming: Apply Python for data analysis and automation tasks.
Workflow Software (Power Flows): Develop and manage workflows using Power Flows.
Data Cleaning: Perform data cleaning to ensure data quality and integrity.
Statistics: Apply statistical methods to analyze data and support decision-making.


ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Building, Automation, and Modelling of:


Data gathering, identifying sources, and current data structures.
Creating automation, where allowable, to move data to consolidated folders as a workflow data source (typically Excel, CSV, SQL data in the pre-cleaned/transformation state).
Extracting and transforming data with a forward-looking solution (mitigation of current issues).
Building SQL data structures/procedures to stage and move data to production.
Building models to process data and generate predictions/insights.
Building checks and balances for notification of data changes that may prompt updates to the workflow.
Working with the Data Engineering team to implement automated solutions.
Pulling the data into the Power BI repositories for visualization by our team and other teams.
Transforming data into a new structure.
Building visualizations where needed.



Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please advise when submitting your application.

Please note that Tilray does not authorize, engage, or sponsor any consultants, agencies or organizations that seek certain personal or financial information from you (e.g. passwords, login ids, credit card information). Tilray does not charge any application, processing or onboarding fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process.

When replying to emails, please ensure the sender name and email address match exactly. Please also ensure the Reply-To address matches the sending address exactly.

If you are concerned about the authenticity of an email, letter, or call purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Tilray, please send an email inquiry to infosec@tilray.com

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:

Bondi Produce is a progressive family-owned and operated food distribution company with a focus on fresh produce and specialty ingredients. We are a recognized brand amongst Toronto’s most distinguished chefs and strive to be a leader in our industry. We are passionate about food and committed to being on the cutting edge of what’s next in our industry.




General Summary:

Reporting to the VP, Finance, with a dotted line to VP, Sales and VP, Supply Chain, the Pricing and Data Analyst shall handle the analysis and interpretation of market data, implement pricing strategies, and predict future market trends. The Pricing and Data Analyst will work closely with Sales, Procurement, and Operations teams to ensure the pricing reflects market shifts and supply constraints.




Key Responsibilities and Duties:

1. Pricing Model Management

Develop, maintain, and enhance pricing models to align with evolving market conditions and internal strategic priorities.
Create data-driven methodologies for setting sustainable price levels across multiple product lines and customer segments.

2. Market Analysis & Intelligence

Gather, monitor, and interpret relevant commodity market data, competitor pricing, and industry trends.
Provide daily, weekly, or monthly market updates to guide procurement and sales teams in critical decision-making.

3. Margin & Profitability Assessments

Conduct margin analyses to evaluate profitability across various products and customers.
Recommend price adjustments to meet targets, mitigate risks, and capture new opportunities.

4. Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with Sales, Procurement, and Operations teams to ensure pricing reflects real-time market shifts and supply constraints.
Serve as a liaison to Finance to uphold clear, consistent financial and margin reporting standards.

5. Forecasting & Budgeting

Build and maintain forecasting models to anticipate market fluctuations and potential cost variations.
Contribute to budgeting processes by providing projections on revenue, margins, and overall price performance.

6. Reporting & Communication

Produce dashboards and presentations to communicate pricing impact, margin variance, and performance against targets.
Deliver clear, concise insights and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels.

7. Process Improvement and Innovation

Identify opportunities to refine pricing processes using technology, automation, or advanced analytics.
Comfortable navigating industry shifts and supply chain disruptions, offering proactive solutions.
Stay updated on industry’s best practices, incorporating new tools or approaches to keep pricing strategies cutting-edge.
Other ad-hoc financial & procurement project work as required.




Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business, Data Analytics, or a related field.
5-7 years of experience in pricing, financial analysis, or revenue management preferably within the food service or consumer goods industry.
Proven track record of working as a Pricing and Data Analyst effectively with cross-functional teams.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite with advanced Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas).
Proficiency in BI/analytics tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Experience with ERP systems and data management is a plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to translate raw data into actionable insights.
Ability to conduct scenario planning, sensitivity analyses and problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills, including writing skills, and presentations.
Strong attention to detail with a sense of urgency to prioritize, plan, and organize.
Ability to work under pressure with a high level of efficiency.
Entrepreneurial mindset and a roll-up-the-sleeves work ethic; must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.




What We Offer:

Competitive base pay along with a comprehensive benefits package.
On-site fitness centre.
Staff grocery purchase program.




Bondi embraces diversity in the workplace environment. The company encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regards to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, disability, age, religion, or any other classification protected by law. Please forward your application with an updated resume to hr@bondiproduce.com.

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist
Description:
At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that’s not all. Whether we’re leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada.

Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you.

Reporting to the Data Insights and Enablement Director, the Senior BI Specialist will be responsible for creating advanced dashboards, analyzing data trends, automating workflows, and collaborating across departments to design and implement strategies that support business objectives.

You reside in: Toronto OR Ottawa

You'll be responsible for:


Capturing business requirements, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of stakeholder needs and objectives while aligning with Interac’s business objectives.
Design, build, and deploy robust BI solutions based on business requirements.
Establish visualization best practices, optimize dashboards, and explore innovative data representation methods to uncover new business opportunities across all levels of the organization.
Analyze business intelligence data to provide leadership with actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Develop in-depth commentary and insights and create compelling presentations that clearly communicate the data's narrative.
Develop complex, comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards using internal data infrastructure and external data sources.
Identify and assess industry/geographic trends, competitor strategies, and customer behavior to anticipate opportunities and challenges.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data in all reporting.


You bring:


A degree in Business, Mathematics, or equivalent combination of education and industry experience.
At least 5+ years of hands-on experience as a BI Developer, creating complex dashboards and algorithms.
Expert in using BI tools with expertise/certifications in at least one of the following BI software tools: Tableau (Preferred), Power BI, Qlik, Domo, Sisense.
Strong knowledge of Python/R and ability to write stored procedures, views, and SQL functions.
Strong data modelling and UI/UX design skills considered an asset. Proven experience in data analysis, visualization, and storytelling; developing meaningful and insightful presentations for varies stakeholders.
Interpret and communicate complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Excellent organization, planning, and prioritizing skills with a proactive approach to resolving issues.
Understanding that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
You are a proactive problem-solver with a demonstrated track record of driving continuous improvement initiatives.
Experience Configuring and maintaining BI environment including row level security is an asset.
Eligibility to work for Interac Corp. in Canada in a full-time capacity.


Interac requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks:


Canadian criminal record check;
Public safety verification;
Canadian ID cross-check;
5-year employment verification;
Education verification; and
If applicable, Credit Inquiry and Social Media Check


How We Work

We know that exceptional people have great ideas and are passionate about their work. Our culture encourages excellence and actively rewards contributions with:

Connection: You’re surrounded by talented people every day who are driven by their passion of a common goal.

Core Values: They define us. Living them helps us be the best at what we do.

Compensation & Benefits: Pay is driven by individual and corporate performance and we provide a multitude of benefits and perks.

Education: To ensure you are the best at what you do we invest in you

Please be aware of certain individuals fraudulently using Interac Corp.’s name and logo to offer fictitious employment opportunities. Interac Corp. will never ask, solicit, nor accept any monies in exchange for employment opportunities. Any such offers of employment are fraudulent and invalid, and you are strongly advised to exercise great caution and disregard such offers and invitations.

Please note that under no circumstances shall Interac Corp. be held liable or responsible for any claims, losses, damages, expenses, or other inconveniences resulting from or in any way connected to the actions of individuals performing such fraud. Further, such fraudulent communication shall not be treated as any kind of offer or representation by Interac Corp. or its subsidiaries and affiliates.

At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that’s not all. Whether we’re leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada.

Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you.

Reporting to the Data Insights and Enablement Director, the Senior BI Specialist will be responsible for creating advanced dashboards, analyzing data trends, automating workflows, and collaborating across departments to design and implement strategies that support business objectives.

You reside in: Toronto OR Ottawa

You'll be responsible for:

  • Capturing business requirements, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of stakeholder needs and objectives while aligning with Interac’s business objectives.
  • Design, build, and deploy robust BI solutions based on business requirements.
  • Establish visualization best practices, optimize dashboards, and explore innovative data representation methods to uncover new business opportunities across all levels of the organization.
  • Analyze business intelligence data to provide leadership with actionable insights for informed decision-making.
  • Develop in-depth commentary and insights and create compelling presentations that clearly communicate the data's narrative.
  • Develop complex, comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards using internal data infrastructure and external data sources.
  • Identify and assess industry/geographic trends, competitor strategies, and customer behavior to anticipate opportunities and challenges.
  • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data in all reporting.

You bring:

  • A degree in Business, Mathematics, or equivalent combination of education and industry experience.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence (12-Month Contract)
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world’s most admired and respected institutional investors. With more than $600 billion in assets under management, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure it is financially sustainable for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

As a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence, you will assist in gathering, managing, analyzing, and reporting of financial data to enable actionable insights and recommendations that support strategic decision-making processes. You will also be responsible for designing new dashboards to measure, analyze, and explain key aspects of the Fund’s activities.

Accountabilities


Utilize financial systems (e.g., Oracle planning module) to support period-end close processes, budgeting, and forecasting, and produce insightful dashboards and reports on cost drivers and trends.
Develop and automate reporting using technology to provide insights at scale
Iterative build and prototype dashboards, solving for analytical needs to drive data-centric decision-making, using tools like AWS QuickSight and Tableau.
Document processes and governance policies to ensure data integrity and system reliability.
Manage and maintain data from source systems, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Collaborate with various departments to understand their data needs and provide tailored analytical solutions.
Leverage technical tools (i.e. SQL, Python, Excel macros), complex data analysis on large volumes of unstructured data to validate data, investigate and resolve system and data issues.
Support Product Owners with analysis, prioritization, planning and delivery of new features and capabilities based on user needs.
Assist in developing test cases and automating control checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used.
Leverage analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills to work with data providers and end users in assessing, transforming, and storing data for analytical and reporting requirements.
Participate in the development and implementation of new BI tools and technologies to enhance data analysis capabilities.
Manage your own workload to perform time-sensitive requests accurately and on time, while building effective working relationships within your team and across various groups at CPP Investments.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics and reporting to enhance skills and capabilities.


Qualifications


Undergraduate degree or college diploma in related field.
3+ year of relevant experience.
Relevant professional designation (MBA, CPA or CFA) or progression toward one considered an asset.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience in data visualization tools (e.g., AWS QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI) and financial systems (e.g., Oracle)
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple priorities.
Demonstrated a thirst for learning new concepts and skills in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Health Records Chart Reviewer
Description:
Job Number: JR102479

Job Title: Health Records Chart Reviewer

Job Category: Professional

Hospital Location: General Site

Job Type: Temporary (Fixed Term), Part time

Contract Duration: 15 months

Number of Positions: 1

Hours: All Shifts

Across our three hospitals and eight satellite sites, Scarborough Health Network (SHN) is shaping the future of care. Our many programs and services are designed around the needs of one of Canada’s most vibrant and diverse communities. We are home to North America’s largest nephrology program, as well as the designated cardiac care and spine centre for Scarborough and surrounding communities to the east. We are proud to be a community-affiliated teaching site for the University of Toronto and partner with a number of other universities and colleges, helping to train the next generation of health care professionals. SHN is the recipient of the Excellence in Diversity and Inclusion Award, from the Canadian College of Health Leaders, for our work led by the Organizational Development and Diversity Department on our Leading edge Communities of Inclusion, Inclusion Calendar and our innovative Health Equity Certificate programs. We are also proud to be named Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2023! Learn more at shn.ca

Job Description

Position Overview:

As a Data Analyst chart reviewer, you must be a CHIM certified with a dept knowledge of reviewing and analysing Inpatient medical coding (ICD10CA/CCI) in an Acute hospital setting.

The incumbent will be responsible for performing a variety of health information functions related to various databases within Health Coding services. The Data Analyst chart reviewer is the liaison between the clinicians and the HIM professionals, ensuring data quality concerns are appropriately addressed as it relates to collection and optimization of clinical documentation and ICD10CA/CCI coding. You may be scheduled at the General or Birchmount campus based on departmental needs.

Requirements


Possess a University degree or Diploma in Health Information Management
Current registration with Canadian Health Information Management Association (CHIMA)
Minimum 5 years acute care Inpatient(DAD) coding experience in a hospital setting
Knowledge of Canada’s Health Care System with thorough understanding of CIHI’s case mix grouping (CMG+) and Resource Intensity Weight (RIW) along with Ontario funding reform, HBAM Inpatient Grouper and HBAM Inpatient Weight (HIG)
Thorough knowledge and understanding of MIS guidelines
Experience working with WinRecs abstracting system and Meditech
Excellent skills and in depth knowledge of DAD and NACRS coding to perform chart audits and supervising the team QA.
Must be proficient in scripting reports through Crystal report writer for data quality and reporting purposes
Responsible for pro-active and retrospective audits on coded data to ensure alignment with ICD-10/CCI standards and accuracy
Responsible for initiating analyses related to the quality of clinical documentation and the accuracy of its subsequent collection to ensure data quality standards
Develops, distributes and promotes materials with a focus on clinical documentation
The Data Analyst chart reviewer must have knowledge of providing data submission and correction files to CIHI, CCO and CCN
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Windows, Excel and Word)
Demonstrates values consistent with SHN’s Code of Conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation.
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization and develop and maintain respectful interpersonal relations
Excellent work performance, attention to detail and attendance and effective team work skills
Demonstrates excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrates a commitment to customer service when dealing with patients, colleagues and volunteers and other members of the community and public
Demonstrates values consistent with SHN's Code of Conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation.
Demonstrates an understanding of and commitment to SHN's comprehensive safety programs and practices including staff safety, patient safety, and environmental safety and participates in regular in-service education in this area.
Demonstrates excellent work performance and attendance record


Asset


Ability to speak another language is an asset


Accommodation And Diversity Statement

Scarborough Health Network (SHN) embraces and celebrates our community’s unique multicultural heritage and diversity. SHN is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a culture of inclusiveness and diversity reflecting our diverse patients, staff and community alike.

We are committed to fostering an environment of equity and inclusivity where every person can work and receive care safely, openly and honestly. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nation of origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital or family status, belief system, or other factors related to one’s personal identity and/or values.

We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our exciting opportunities by following SHNCareers on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook.

Title: Principal Data Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD85676

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en français se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled principal level Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will be pivotal in driving our data and analytics strategy and contributing to our overall business objectives. The ideal candidates will have a passion for data, skilled at uncovering insights, and the technical expertise to implement solutions that propel our business forward.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in either Toronto or Montreal, Canada This role reports to the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
Proactively mine for data drive insights to support initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed


Minimum Qualifications


8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives


Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline


Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Description Du Poste

Nous recherchons un analyste de données hautement qualifié de niveau principal pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la mise en œuvre de notre stratégie en matière de données et d'analyse et contribuerez à la réalisation de nos objectifs commerciaux globaux. Les candidats idéaux sont passionnés par les données, habiles à découvrir des perspectives commerciales et dotés de l'expertise technique nécessaire pour mettre en œuvre des solutions qui propulsent notre entreprise vers l'avant.

Vous êtes passionné par la fourniture d'informations proactives et le partenariat avec les parties prenantes pour générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route du produit. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes de produits en faisant émerger des données précieuses sur l'utilisation des clients et des produits et en agissant en tant que partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant dans la transformation des idées en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte des tendances et la traduction de grands flux de données en informations claires et exploitables fera avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et améliorera la prise de décision au sein de notre organisation.

Ce poste sera basé à Toronto ou Montreal Canada. Il est placé sous la responsabilité du Senior Manager, Analytics.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de responsabiliser les équipes et d'influencer l'organisation avec des informations qui mènent au succès, ce poste est fait pour vous !

Responsabilités


Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de produits et les équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'identifier, de définir et de résoudre les problèmes et les occasions d'affaires au moyen de l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour obtenir des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données vastes et complexes
Contrôler et suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI), les objectifs et les résultats clés (OKR) dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme, en fournissant des mises à jour et des informations régulières aux principales parties prenantes et en garantissant la visibilité des informations fondées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de produits, d'ingénierie et d'affaires pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats d'une manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
Exploiter de manière proactive les données pour générer des perspectives commerciales afin de soutenir les initiatives, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
Développez et mettez en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire


Qualifications Minimales


Vous avez plus de 8 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
Vous êtes titulaire d'une licence dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
Vous avez l'esprit d'équipe et une grande capacité à travailler dans plusieurs fonctions, à vous engager auprès de diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques


Qualifications Souhaitées


Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe

Learn More / Plus d'information

About Autodesk / À Propos D’Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Bienvenue à Autodesk ! Des choses incroyables sont créées chaque jour avec nos logiciels - des bâtiments les plus écologiques et des voitures les plus propres aux usines les plus intelligentes et aux plus grands films à succès. Nous aidons les innovateurs à transformer leurs idées en réalité, transformant non seulement la façon dont les choses sont faites, mais ce qui peut être fait.

Nous sommes très fiers de notre culture ici chez Autodesk - notre code en matière de culture est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nos valeurs et nos méthodes de travail aident nos employés à prospérer et à réaliser leur potentiel, ce qui conduit à des résultats encore meilleurs pour nos clients.

Lorsque vous êtes un employé Autodesk, vous pouvez être entier et authentique et effectuer un travail significatif qui aide à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous. Prêt à façonner le monde et votre avenir? Joignez-vous à nous !

Salary transparency / Transparence salariale

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Le salaire est l'un des éléments de l'offre compétitive d'Autodesk. Les offres sont basées sur l'expérience et la situation géographique du candidat. Outre les salaires de base, nous accordons également une grande importance aux primes annuelles discrétionnaires en espèces, aux commissions pour les fonctions de vente, aux actions ou aux primes d'encouragement à long terme en espèces, ainsi qu'à un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.

Job Requisition ID #

25WD85676

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en français se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled principal level Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will be pivotal in driving our data and analytics strategy and contributing to our overall business objectives. The ideal candidates will have a passion for data, skilled at uncovering insights, and the technical expertise to implement solutions that propel our business forward.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in either Toronto or Montreal, Canada This role reports to the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
  • Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
  • Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
  • Proactively mine for data drive insights to support initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
  • Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed

Minimum Qualifications

  • 8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
  • Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
  • Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
  • Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
  • Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
  • Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline

Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Description Du Poste

Nous recherchons un analyste de données hautement qualifié de niveau principal pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la mise en œuvre de notre stratégie en matière de données et d'analyse et contribuerez à la réalisation de nos objectifs commerciaux globaux. Les candidats idéaux sont passionnés par les données, habiles à découvrir des perspectives commerciales et dotés de l'expertise technique nécessaire pour mettre en œuvre des solutions qui propulsent notre entreprise vers l'avant.

Vous êtes passionné par la fourniture d'informations proactives et le partenariat avec les parties prenantes pour générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route du produit. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes de produits en faisant émerger des données précieuses sur l'utilisation des clients et des produits et en agissant en tant que partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant dans la transformation des idées en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte des tendances et la traduction de grands flux de données en informations claires et exploitables fera avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et améliorera la prise de décision au sein de notre organisation.

Ce poste sera basé à Toronto ou Montreal Canada. Il est placé sous la responsabilité du Senior Manager, Analytics.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de responsabiliser les équipes et d'influencer l'organisation avec des informations qui mènent au succès, ce poste est fait pour vous !

Responsabilités

  • Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de produits et les équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'identifier, de définir et de résoudre les problèmes et les occasions d'affaires au moyen de l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour obtenir des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données vastes et complexes
  • Contrôler et suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI), les objectifs et les résultats clés (OKR) dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme, en fournissant des mises à jour et des informations régulières aux principales parties prenantes et en garantissant la visibilité des informations fondées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de produits, d'ingénierie et d'affaires pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats d'une manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
  • Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
  • Exploiter de manière proactive les données pour générer des perspectives commerciales afin de soutenir les initiatives, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
  • Développez et mettez en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
  • Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire

Qualifications Minimales

  • Vous avez plus de 8 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
  • Vous êtes titulaire d'une licence dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
  • Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
  • Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
  • Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
  • Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
  • Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
  • Vous avez l'esprit d'équipe et une grande capacité à travailler dans plusieurs fonctions, à vous engager auprès de diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques

Qualifications Souhaitées

  • Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
  • Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
  • Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe

Title: Intern, Data Quality
Description:
Job Description

Baycrest Centre for Geriatric Care has an opportunity for a

INTERN, DATA QUALITY

Human Resources Shared Services Centre

Position Type: Temporary Full-Time (12 Weeks)

Shift Type: Day, Onsite

Bi-Weekly Hours: 70 Hours

Hours of Work: 7 hrs/shift

Posting Number: 8734

Union: Non-Union

Date Posted: March 7, 2025

Job Summary:

The Data Quality role focuses primarily on data mining, identifying gaps in records, data accuracy audits of historical data, analyzing and interpreting workforce data to support strategic planning, improve organizational development, and optimize workforce strategies.

The position aims to provide support to the Data Analytics team in building templates using current technology and informatics to measure KPIs with the HR functions such as employee relations, compensation and benefits, performance management, and organizational development until the organization implements a HCM system that supports these capabilities.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


Data Cleansing and Auditing of Historical Workforce Data:
Conduct thorough data profiling and analysis to identify data quality issues for historical data.
Responsible to ensure that historical workforce reports have been reviewed and audited before March 31, 2025.
Execute processes for resolving and documenting data quality issues that are identified during the audit process.
Development of Current and Ongoing Reporting Templates:
Assist the Senior Data Analyst to establish reporting templates to monitor and improve data quality, ensuring accuracy, consistency for ongoing reports.
Work with Senior Data Analyst to identify opportunities to optimize current reporting structures and promote self-service analytics.
Review current reports and automate manual data entry processes wherever possible using macros and algorithms that improve efficiency and data accuracy.
Future Reporting and Analytics for 2025 and beyond.
Assist the Senior Data Analyst in meeting the following deliverables:
Design and create Power BI dashboards, executive presentations, and ad-hoc reports, providing insights on key HR metrics. Ensure the delivery of predictive analytics and actionable recommendations to drive data-driven decisions across the organization.
Conduct in-depth analyses of HR data to identify trends, anomalies, and forecasts
Translate complex data insights into recommendations that influence talent management


Qualifications:


Bachelor's or master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., data management, information technology, data analytics, business analytics, informatics)
Advanced certification in data analysis or HR analytics (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is preferred.
Expert in Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).
Ability to develop interactive dashboards using Advanced Excel is a key requirement in this role.
Strong Visualization skills and ability to create strong presentations.
Ability to manipulate, analyze and transform large datasets to understand trends and patterns
Proven experience in data quality management, particularly in establishing and implementing data quality frameworks
Experience in data profiling, cleansing, and validation
Proficiency in data manipulation languages like SQL
Programming skills (Python, R) can be beneficial
Working knowledge of cloud computing platforms. MS Azure preferred (Microsoft Synapse, Azure Data factory, Azure Data Lake, Power BI, Tableau)


Additional Benefits:


Competitive Salary and Vacation
Opportunity to enroll in the Dental and Extended Healthcare Benefit Plan
Opportunity to enroll in the Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP)
Access to 24/7 Employee Assistance Program


INTERNAL APPLICANTS: Please submit your application online through the Baycrest intranet. Failure to include your resume may affect your candidacy for this position. All communication related to this job posting will be sent to the email address used to submit your application.

EXTERNAL APPLICANTS: Please submit your application online by clicking the Apply button below.

Remarkable people of Baycrest are changing the future of brain health and aging.

Thank you for your interest in joining Baycrest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Baycrest is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (‘AODA’). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources at recruitment@baycrest.org or 416-785-2500, ext. 2961.

All successful candidates will be required to complete a police reference check/vulnerable sector screen. Such exemptions will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
